docs.title: Open Mic List
docs.text: Welcome! This site keeps track of the local Open Mic Poetry events in Austin.

docs.title: Poetry Festivals!
docs.text:
April is Poetry Month, come check out these Festivals!

16th Annual TableRock Poetry Festival April 27th 2PM to 9PM El Salado, TX Theme is Animal Rescue Hosted by Thom the World Poet and Sandi Horton Release of Animal Rescue Anthology

Round Top Poetry Festival April 19th through 21st

docs.title: Sundays
docs.text: Spoken and Heard Open Mic Kick Butt Coffee 5775 W Airport Blvd. 7-10 PM sign up starts at 6:30

docs.title: First Thursdays
docs.text: Wake the Dead Open Mic 1432 Old Ranch Road 12 San Marcos, Texas Hosted by Jaime Torres

docs.title: First Saturdays (typically)
docs.text: Art Spark Texas Virtual Inclusive Open mic for writers/performers/musicians email from website to sign up 1-2:30 PM also, check out Art Spark TX Radio Hour on KOOP from 2-3 PM CST

docs.title: First Sundays
docs.text: Georgetown Public Library Open Mic 2 - 4 PM 402 W. 8th St Georgetown, TX

docs.title: Third Saturdays

docs.title: Third Saturdays every other Month
docs.text: Poetry in Motion 1:30 - 3:30 PM Round Rock Library 300 E Liberty Ave, Round Rock TX

docs.title: Following month in Pflugerville Public Library

docs.title: Poetry Groups
docs.text:
Austin Poetry Society

Writer's League of Texas - One Page Salon First Tuesday of the Month Radio Coffee and Beer 4204 Menchaca Road South Austin

docs.title: Bookwoman
docs.text: Opened 45 years ago on Guadalupe in Central Austin One of the best local bookstores that has one of the best selections of books on Poetry, LGBTQ, Spirituality, Activism, Politics, Culture, Fiction and more! Say Hello to Susana who runs this shop with great Love Central Austin

docs.title: Reverie Books
docs.text: Another amazing local bookstore! Opened during the Pandemic Great selection of Banned Books, LGBTQ, Indie, Black History and more! 5330 Menchaca Rd Ste D Say Hello to Thais who runs the shop along with many great events, check out their site! South Austin

docs.title: The Painted Porch
docs.text: Another bookstore opened during the Pandemic Ryan Holiday is an author and speaker who lives in Bastrop Check out any of books on stoicism, history, marketing and more! One of the best and brightest authors of our times who continues to release bestsellers of the highest quality Bastrop Texas

docs.title: Contact Us
docs.text:
This site is owned and maintained by Bijan Rahnamai.

Have a question or want your open mic/event listed on this site? You can reach out to us at bijan@bijanrahnamai.com

https://bijanrahnamai.com/

docs.title: Great is Diana
docs.text:
Austin International Poetry Festival di-verse-city 2012 Anthology

Like softly muttering lightning far aview, Nature is beautiful, just look, you'll see —More beautiful than paint or poetry, More beautiful than aught our brains can brew, Than things our recent artists draw or hew, As beautiful as flower to a bee, As spider to the wasp, or wasp to me With orange wings, rest deep metallic blue. Our arts give beauties echos at their bests, Our best acknowledges the Muse midwife, above all kings, above all Kings of kings, Diana, whose milky-nippled myriad breasts feed every art as well as every life, whose ancient timeless beauty gives birth to all things.

docs.title: Record Collectors
docs.text:
Crate Diggers & Beatmakers of Austin Meetup Typically held at the Capital Factory, Downtown Austin 701 Brazos St. (see Meetup Link for details) Every 2nd Tuesday of the Month

Austin Record Convention The largest sale of recorded music in the USA. Next Show: Spring 2024 - May 4th and 5th, 2024 Happens twice a year, in Spring (May) and Fall (October)
